website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for top of the line when it comes to speed plus WiFi in one device, this is the NETGEAR model for you.
pros: Compatible with Xfinity from Comcast, Cox, and others for plans of up to 16 Gbps
Includes four gigabit Ethernet ports and is fully backward compatible
cons: Like other NETGEAR models, this isn't compatible with AT&T or Verizon
Some buyers also complained of their signal dropping

customer_reviews.title: An improvement from leased equipment - but has some hiccups.
customer_reviews.text: This is a short non-technical review that I hope will be of some help to those shopping for a Xfinity/Comcast friendly modem. When it works, it's super fast and great. When it gets buggy, I want to pull my hair out and I question myself for paying so much for something that is inconsistent. Pros: Set-up was a breeze Definite improvement in speed Cons: No QoS Port Forwarding does not work Signal drops repeatedly throughout the day
customer_reviews.author: HappyFeetInTheSand

customer_reviews.title: Does not work correctly with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: WARNING!!! This product does not work correctly with Comcast. You cannot open ports for other devices to work properly and the router needs to be restarted at least daily to fix a slowdown issue. Netgear blames Comcast and Comcast blames Netgear for these issues. Netgear is aware of these issues. It took me too long to figure this out and I am unable to return the product. A very expensive mistake indeed. The first image shows great speed when working properly, the second is before the restart. Netgear will not do an exchange for you. Update: Amazon refunded with return of the product.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Turk

customer_reviews.title: Gigantic hardware and networking software from the 90s
customer_reviews.text: First off, I'm a full stack engineer from San Francisco and have been working with computer networking since the grade school. I bought this to replace a DLink that was a few years old when I wanted to upgrade to Gigabit. Not only do I get no where near gigabit (this may be more of an isp issue) , I have to reset the modem/router almost every month as it basically drops all connections to any wired devices I have setup. Honestly, after using other networking software for years I was curious to see what Netgear was up too. WHY DID I NOT BELIEVE THE OTHER REVIEWS! My hubris definitely got the best of me here :( goodbye $400 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid At All Costs
customer_reviews.text: Cyber Monday purchase. I don't typically purchase modem-router combos, as I like the flexibility in maintaining and updating my own devices; but I read the reviews, and optimistically hoped that I'd select a device that would work, as some have experienced no issues. This unit functioned properly for approximately six full operational days before the bugs in the firmware kicked in - probably assisted by some hardware failures as well. Who knows. Tech community consensus is that the issues are primarily the firmware, which is, understandably in this use case, supplied by the ISP; which is why I tend to not purchase all in one solutions. Worth noting, when the device ran properly, it was everything as advertised. RIP NETGEAR
customer_reviews.author: Tony A.

customer_reviews.title: Netgear is Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage Netgear X4S AC3200 (Model C7800), Second time screwed by Netgear Garbage but no more Netgear Garbage. Netgear X4S AC3200 (Model C7800) 30 Days and stopped working and ofcourse after 30 days you can't return it, completely garbage, and the support is some guy in India. Comcast Technician said it is not the Internet or the cable outside the house it is the device and I thought the same thing Netgear support said it's my ISP but no it's Netgear garbage I had Motorola before and it was really good. UPDATE: 5/26/18 I rent Xfinity/Comcast router for $11 a month and it's working fine on the other hand I paid $424 for this garbage
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Doumani

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase I’ve Made in Awhile
customer_reviews.text: I should have done this a year ago. I live in a 2200 square foot one story house with several users and gaming. My current Arris Gateway was giving me inconsistent WiFi download speeds and dropping internet connections frequently. After switching to this, I now have both 2.4 G and 5G WiFi connections. 2.4G gives me 60 mbps and 5G 150+ mbps for my 150 mbps Xfinity Comcast service. Set up was relatively easy. Took about 40 minutes to get internet connection to phones and computers and a few hours of time to reset WiFi for all my other devices. The fast consistent speeds I get now make this purchase well worth the higher price tag.
customer_reviews.author: jkl

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Work As Intended
customer_reviews.text: Works with Cable ONE 1GB service perfectly. Software is a little lacking with features. The 2.4GHz seems to be unstable when compared to other routers, but the 5GHz is spot-on. Range is very excellent. I get 1GB speed throughout the house on 5GHz. This thing is huge so it might be best to mount it on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Tech support marginal at best giving me excuses and the runaround
customer_reviews.text: An expensive piece of electronic junk. Every couple of hours the WiFi cuts off requiring a reboot. So much so for their WiFi signal strength. Beyond 30ft it's dead. When I spoke with tech support they suggested a $90 range Extender. This is also being returned. Tech support marginal at best giving me excuses and the runaround. Could not get connected with a level 2 tech, so had to chat with people in the Far East. Going to Arris Surfboard which might not have all the bells and whistles but at least has a WiFi signal.
customer_reviews.author: the whiz

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Recieved the 1st Netgear Nighthawk had to call netgear customer support, because product did not get 1g just 540 Mbps download and up stream of 35 Mbps. Netgear gave me a service number and said to return back to Amazon for replacement. Amazon sent 2 more which had broken parts inside. Called Amazon and the customer service representatives said that they could not send out a replacement until they receive all units back and the price would be higher then what I paid. I will be streaming a live video on YouTube showing the items I recieved broken and how this product response during A speed test. All I wanted was a new netgear that functions properly in return!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip James Sanchez III

customer_reviews.title: Signal constantly drops
customer_reviews.text: The device is crap. Been using it for a while (~3 months), and it's just gotten worse. 5G never worked. The COX guy came out and checked everything--their system was doing fine, but something amiss with this Netgear modem/router. After lots of tweaking and working with the router login, I was able to get 5G to come on line for about 10 minutes, and then it dropped off completely, along with the 2.4 signal. Rebooting, I'm able to get 2.4 on a really spotty basis....talking speeds of a few bytes per second. I'm hoping there's some kind of fix, but I'm not holding out too much hope.
customer_reviews.author: ArtFanMan

customer_reviews.title: Much faster than the AC1900
customer_reviews.text: I put my entire house together and ran Cat6 and coax to every room, but of course still needed robust wifi for all the handheld devices. My house has concrete interior and exterior walls and the wifi signal had a hard time getting around from the stock Comcast modem, so I upgraded to the Nighthawk AC1900. I also added a second Nighthawk as a wifi booster in the living room. Even then I was having wifi cutout problems. Installing this made all the difference in the world, particularly with the 5ghz band. Very fast, maxing out my quoted speed at 160 mbps. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: matthewpartrick

customer_reviews.title: Such a price, and then it does not work. Disappointing and frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: Essentially, it does not work. I have tried all what i can do to get it to stop dropping connections. Errors in logs. Comcast/Xfinity checked everything and no issues. We also got their leased router, and it works perfectly, not this one. So basically it must be something with the model. Now, i have 300$ sitting in my garage collecting dust!! A joke. I wish i have returned it ASAP. Now too late.
customer_reviews.author: sat

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase, Netgear is garbage and so is their technical support
customer_reviews.text: Netgear products are trash. This device was purchased in March 2019 and the LAN ports have already stopped functioning as of May 2019. Technical support is non-existent. If you call for assistance, you will literally be told to unplug it and plug it back in. When that doesn’t work, they immediately give up and issue an RMA. Even better, despite being well within the warranty period, you cannot get a replacement router until you return their defective product or want to pay Netgear more money to send you a new one before the return. Don’t buy this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Goins

customer_reviews.title: Worst Netgear Product
customer_reviews.text: I paid premium price for this product. Thinking it will give me 1Gigabit as advertised, I have gigablast service from cox in san diego. Few visits from cox technicians at my house and never able to get more than 200-300 mbps. Cox technician showed me using his modem, that line is capable of delivering gigabast. i was admitted to hospital for some heart condition after spending 1 month in recovery, now my product return window is gone. I am stuck with this product. I wish if i can return this and just go with another docsis3.1 modem only and seperate router rather than this combo,
customer_reviews.author: R. Kapur

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This C7800 drops the internet connection consistently. Network Engineers from Comcast Xfinity stated issue not on their end and they are correct. Other routers that I have had no issue whatsoever. Netgear sent a replacement and same problem. No Refunds and customer support is from India reading me their useless prompts from their computer screen. Was told their is now way to provide further support so now I have a product that does not work. Please be aware if you are thinking about purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Netgear is GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a great addition to go with our 1 gig internet service. I ended up waisting 4 hours trying to reach tech support. 5 of 6 calls were answered and emediately hung up on, the only time I finally got a hold of someone, he was a complete A$$! He acted like I was an idiot, just to find out he couldn’t solve the issue. I could not connect any device to 5G and only one device at a time could connect via network cable. I’ll never buy Netgear again. 2/2 have been just garbage. Going back to Arris.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Wi Fi signal was poor
customer_reviews.text: For a 1k router/modem combo with the claimed ability to be able to channel up to 2k it was barely doing 100mps on it's best day and most of the time worse. After trouble shooting with the cable company and NetGear it was determined it was a hardware issue and I received a new one which did the same exact thing. I returned it for a different router and modem separate from each other also from NetGear. I am a long time NetGear user and have always been very impressed with the products they produce but this unit is just very poor.
customer_reviews.author: T S

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last
customer_reviews.text: Was a breeze to install. Works well with cox gigablast. Looks nice too Update. The past few weeks have been horrible. Internet started to disconnect and in game lag became more and more noticeable. Tried everything...factory reset, hard reboots...wont let me update firmware. No response from netgear either. Called my internet provider and nothing was wrong with signal strength. The past week was the worse. Constant disconnects and slow downs almost every half hour. Speed tests ran max 400mbps(i have 1gig internet). Finally gave up and bought a new modem and separate router. Was never a fan of netgear but i gave this one a chance. Kicking myself at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Dong Lee

customer_reviews.title: If you want an all in one DODCSIS 3.1 modem router combo this is the only way to go
customer_reviews.text: If you want whatever brand of Gig Speed service from whatever internet provider you have and have a four gigabit wired switches in one device this is the only way to go, period. I don't use the WiFi portion of the device so I can't comment on it. However, I have Cox Gigblast service, and I have this device connected to four different rooms with 4 different switches, and consistently have 1.1 Gbps on Speed.com and 909 Mbps on SPEEDTEST in each room.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speed and range, easy setup. does not lock or crash, slightly bulky antennas, but quality of service it provides makes it well worth the price and size. the broad range of channels allows for fast connection speeds in a dense neighborhood during peek internet usage hours, (when the neighborhood all gets home from school/work). I feel like i get the full use of my internet for the first time. you not only get what you pay for from this device, but you get what you pay for from your service provider at all hours of the day and night.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It died with a year
customer_reviews.text: It died after 11 months of use. Getting a replacement was a nightmare, took 3 hour long phone calls, by the time it was over I felt like they we were my customer, not like I was the customer. Also setting this modem set up with comcast is an equal nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W Miller

customer_reviews.title: This actually is a FANTASTIC Modem!
customer_reviews.text: I just switched from my existing Xfinity/Comcast leased modem, which was dropping signal constantly and the range was very limited, to this new Netgear unit. I specifically purchased the fastest one available: NETGEAR Nighthawk X4S DOCSIS 3.1 Ultra-High Speed Cable Modem Router (C7800). The unit installed very fast and easy. The instructions were actually accurate, which is rare. I had no issues and didn't even need to call Comcast. Just follow the quick start guide exactly and you should have no issues. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent modem/router combo
customer_reviews.text: I thought I went overboard when I first bought this router, and my wife almost killed me. However, the performance of this equipment is amazing. My TV's run on the 5G Wi-Fi with amazing quality for streaming (we don't have cable or satellite for watching TV, so we stream everything). And everyone's computers and gaming works great without any lag, even when we are all doing something online. (**Disclaimer - we pay for the higher tier of speed through our internet provider to make sure we can maintain quality download speeds while we are all online.) I recommend this router if you do a lot of streaming, downloading, and/or gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Magilla80

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my 5g signal
customer_reviews.text: I had to return 3 of these units as it would not allow me to sign onto my 5g wireless network.I was on phone for 1.5 hours with netgear support and they tried everything and told me to send back to amazon because something wrong with 5g card.I can see 1 unit bad but not 3.I won't be buying a netgear product again .
customer_reviews.author: Don M

customer_reviews.title: Very fast & Stable Modem/Router Combination
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Modem/Router! Very, very, fast. Installed as soon as I opened the package and its been running without any downtime since. About 5 months straight now. I am currently running 26 devices on my home network without ANY issues. Settings are easy to find and change, excellent stability and throughput, nice design, I get excellent WIFI coverage through the whole house (about 1800sq Ft). You will not be disappointed, even at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: FathomX

customer_reviews.title: Bad for Cox Cable and connecting to Playstation Live
customer_reviews.text: The issues with connecting to PS Live are well discussed on netgear forums for this Nighthawk c7800 router/modem. In order to get the issue corrected past the 90 day warranty, you have to $29.99 or some nonsense to get them to explain the technical fix. That's extremely poor service when paying $300+ for a router.
customer_reviews.author: BG Money

customer_reviews.title: WARNING TO COMCAST CUSTOMERS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really should have listened to the warnings with Comcast customers. But I did my research and this seemed to be my best option. Bottom line is I could not get my speeds above 450 at all. And it wasn't even consistent and heavy packet loss. Comcast sent a guy to check the device and my speeds. He asked me to at least try the Comcast device. I did and immediately had great speeds 850-950. The wifi speeds suck but I am happy with my hard wired. So sadly I had to return this...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Merkley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Spectrum gigabit in Los Angeles!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router that works great with Spectrum here in Los Angeles. In fact I didn't even need to do the Professional installation they usually insist upon because I already had called up and provisioned it on the phone and it worked perfectly. The tech came, scratched his head, and said okay wow that's great! nice to have a bundled cable modem and high-end router in one!
customer_reviews.author: MrRobot

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Router, love it!
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a bigger house and purchased a 300 MB plan. My previous router and modem were not delivering me the speed i bought and was not able to cover my entire home. I started looked for a DOCSIS 3.1 router and looked at various brands. I found Netgear Nighthawk X4s (c7800). Since i bought i love the Modem + router as it was easy to setup, delivers me the coverage and speed i was looking for and haven't dropped any connections yet. It even covers my whole front & back yard. I strongly recommend this C7800 if you are looking for a device that can provide you a wider coverage and speed. Thanks Netgear for making this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amit Yadav

customer_reviews.title: The BEST WiFi ROUTER ever!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing better than this wifi router! I live in a house built in the late 1950's, and the walls are thick and not good for wifi signal to pass through. I have had several other routers and brands that could not get a signal to my children's room, this router has 5 bars in every room! This is must have for any Techie or family that uses wifi devices.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device! Easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Netgear cable modem c7800 X4S is working really good! We bought Motorola mb8600 but not have WiFi and I can’t share Ethernet with other devices. With this Netgear we have Ethernet sharing 4 devices (eero, Mac, Apple TV and Samsung tv) and we’re receiving 950mbps speed Also, WiFi we’re receiving sometimes 600mbps in our WiFi devices. (Usually WiFi devices receiving the half speed that you pay). We’re happy now!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely rubbish and not worth I
customer_reviews.text: For the cash one has to pay for this modem I’d expect it to be flawless. It is far from that. After installing I wasn’t getting now where near a gig. WiFi was at 200 mgs per second. I called Comcast to complain. The engineer bypassed the Nighthawk and confirmed the incoming speed is 1 gig. In fact it was just over. After resetting everything and choosing unused channels I couldn’t get over 200 mg/s and if I walked into my backyard, which is 30 feet from the modem the signal dropped. I returned it and got another. Same thing. I returned that as well. Absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: The Wizard

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR customer support is a JOKE! Dont gamble your money with this product.
customer_reviews.text: For the 5 months this product worked it was fantastic. Bought the C7800 on Sep 21 2018. On April 16 2019 the wifi completely stopped working. The lights do not come on and the home and wireless tabs in the router settings (192.168.0.1) will not load just repeatedly ask for credentials. I WILL NOT BE GAMBLING MY MONEY WITH NETGEAR AGAIN! Tried to get customer support and they want me to purchase a customer support package... Think about that, their product broke and they want me to pay them to possibly fix it!? I'm livid I spent so much money with such a crap company.
customer_reviews.author: marc anthony

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and fantastic performance
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my xfinity gigabit leased modem. Was able to get this baby up and running in under 10 minutes. Visited the xfinity activation site and it immediately recognized the device — I was online shortly after. Easy to configure and the wireless performance through our tri-level home is much better than with the leased modem.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Decent unit, cheaper elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: It works. What more to say about that? Sometimes the 5GHz WiFi connection will simply disappear on all our devices downstairs. It eventually comes back. Down voted a bit because I bought this a couple of weeks ago here for $X, but I was just walking through a brick-and-mortar big box store (you can guess the one) and saw this on the shelf for $X-$100. Caveat emptor.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kuffler

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem/ Router
customer_reviews.text: I saw an immediate increase in internet speed, from my last modem/ router. Setup was easy, having changed many parameters in the setup, including port forwarding... couldn't be easier. Range is great, and Wi-Fi performance is much better than expected, giving the ability to run 100Mbps service across Wi-Fi. It was my expectation to be able to buy the latest and greatest modem/router combo, to give up-to-date speeds and long service-- so far, this unit doesn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Phil, LA

customer_reviews.title: Not the product you’re looking for...
customer_reviews.text: This product is an extremely overpriced paperweight. I’ve had it for a few months and it requires daily resets to function only a portion of what is advertised. I have many IoT devices, each identified for access to ensure no unwanted connections. I have Gigabit internet that is fully functional. The WiFi connectivity fails daily. Save money and time by avoiding Netgear altogether.
customer_reviews.author: MD Napier

customer_reviews.title: Make sure xfinity removes old modem from account and you connect to 5G before testing speeds
customer_reviews.text: Have Xfinity extreme pro internet package and the nighthawk is definitely compatible...after having a technician come to the house (only to tell me that my old modem was still on my account...it wasn’t active but still on my account therefore not knowing which gateway to send full signal to), I am now receiving WiFi speed tests of 450mbps download, 22mbps upload and even faster directly wired with over 12 devices connected to 5G from Speedtest.net. So far so good!!!
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Big & Bad! (in a good way)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Motorola cable modem that died on me. I wanted something future proof so the DOCSIS 3.1 was important. This modem was easy to install and setup. Biggest problem to it being a self install is having to call the internet provider to provision it. I knew the Nighthawk X4S was going to be huge so that wasn't an issue. So far, I'm really liking this thing!
customer_reviews.author: AntKnee

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and smooth transition.
customer_reviews.text: I like that they addressed how to retire my old router and install the Netgear router with COX directly; there were no ambiguities in the instructions; step by step, easy to understand instructions; the transition went flawlessly. So far, so good with the speed of the router; I seem to detect that it is faster than my old router, with the same speed of service from my internet provider.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL R FONTENOT

customer_reviews.title: Don't Expect a Good Coverage
customer_reviews.text: I decided to free some space on my router and modem place, but this item is huge! Before switching to this one, I had an old Arris modem and an old Nighthawk Wi-Fi router, purchased at Costco 3 years ago. So, my old Wi-Fi router is much better that this one. I returned this item back and bought Arris cable modem instead by connecting my old Nighthawk to it. I'll keep using the old router.
customer_reviews.author: Marat

customer_reviews.title: 2.4GHz won't work
customer_reviews.text: I've had this device since the end of last year. 5GHz side works just fine, but the 2.4GHz side constantly drops connections and lags so badly most of my smart home devices just disconnect. Since this is a cable modem you have to wait for the provider to push out firmware updates which, best I can tell my the NETGEAR community pages has been promised for over a year. So disappointed and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Range is no good
customer_reviews.text: This is my second router in about 5 days. Will be sending this one back as well. The signal is fine if I stay in the room where the router is or even the room next to it, but the second I step out into the hall/the rest of the house, it disappears. Completely. For $350 I should be able to hang out in my neighbor's house and use my wifi. Boooooo.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hutton

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to get rid of my comcast provided modem and I'm very impressed so far. For most of my life I used either the linksys WRT-54G or a tomato router firmware modded Buffalo router, preferring the simple features of those. This is the first "serious" router I've used and I'm very pleased. The wifi signal is GREAT in my 2 story house. Solid connection throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Jerkface

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR C7800 Modem
customer_reviews.text: Funny, the phrase (Old Model) didn't display when I bought the thing 3 weeks ago... The box works as expected. We had a hickup with connection between Comcast and Netgear and a little finger pointing but the problem was resolved in a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love the product I would recommend to anyone looking for a 2 in 1 modem router. Really fast and reliable! Great range too! A must for people looking to get the most out of their Xfinity gig service
customer_reviews.author: Rigo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good but I'm crossing my fingers nothing goes wrong.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this I got it to work properly but the people at Cox restarted the whole process and put the WRONG Mac address, that was the reason why it wouldn't work for us. But after we figured everything out, corrected it, it works flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: iPawl

customer_reviews.title: So far good
customer_reviews.text: Using it for a month now and it's working well as expected , the only think I don't like is the firmware which doesn't give much to do with your router such as VPN and etc. Also remote control is not supported by this router and I wish I knew that before buying it . Rather than that it's a good router .
customer_reviews.author: Alireza

customer_reviews.title: Its a Banger
customer_reviews.text: I dont really shop too much for wifi cable modem routers. Tho... i sure as hell wasnt going to rent one. Bought this outright.. and biy what a penny. Killer tho.. fast, sleek.. looks nice.. no issues setting up. No issues with the seller. This was an all around easy going experience.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel Daggett

customer_reviews.title: Great range
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from an N600. This has much greater range(eliminating my need for an extender in the house). I have a 2-story, approx 2400sq ft house and although I have to put the router in one corner of the house, it gets strong signal from opposite side of house on 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: Hedgemoe

customer_reviews.title: Won't work on Comcast/Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Why is everyone that has comcast having an issue with this modem it lists Comcast as a provider don't buy if you have comcast I'm on my 2nd modem with the same issues
customer_reviews.author: msjilyan

customer_reviews.title: gigablast modem/router combo
customer_reviews.text: most recommended modem/router combo by cable companies...seriously look at NetGear's service plan. 24 hour service.......they will diagnose anything connected to their router/modem..IE cell phones, laptops etc......
customer_reviews.author: joe e

customer_reviews.title: Works well from basement, to main and upper floor ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well from basement, to main and upper floor. No need for boosters with this beauty. I was expecting to need a Google wifi mesh internet router but no need.
customer_reviews.author: Mil

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to reboot at least once a day!!
customer_reviews.text: Different devices keep losing the WiFi connection. Usually it's the printer. New router, and no missing printer. Had to reboot the device at least once a day to be able to print.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Only had it a couple months, but works great so far.
customer_reviews.text: It installed with no setup. Just plugged my cable in and booted up. Instant connection. I had to run through a couple settings to get my cable provider to be configured, but that was easy and took a couple minutes. It has a standard NetGear UI for setting up Admin passwords, and wireless network connections. All very intuitive and easy. Connection speed is great, and signal is very strong. I'v only had it a couple months, but it's performing very well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Todd R Hercules

customer_reviews.title: Network printers not working with MAC
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s working good. I took off 1 star because I cannnot get the USB printer port to work. I’ve read all the tech support docs.. UPDATE - network printers will not work - called Netgear tech support and they want $140 help.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity issue fix!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this modem it was having connectivity issues and was dropping my signal on my Xbox one X. If you have these issues Netgear and you ISP will give you a run around but it's a simple fix. Uncheck airtime fairness and it should fix any connectivity issues. It took me awhile to figure this out so I hope it helps others.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Gets too much dust
customer_reviews.text: So far it has been working great, but I noticed that it captures a lot of dust in the top panel, I imagine this can get inside the components and damage components. I do not want to cover as it can overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Glad I sprung for it
customer_reviews.text: After nothing but headaches trying to use a slightly less expensive Arris that everyone I know recommended, I came back to my original plan and picked up the Nighthawk, and it’s been 100% smooth sailing. The only issue during setup was on my ISP’s end and easily taken care of in one phone call. Easily covers my whole home without issue, handles a ton of devices connected at once with no problem, and is more than handling the top speeds my ISP offers for a residential customer.
customer_reviews.author: UncleKrakken

customer_reviews.title: Great router/cable modem
customer_reviews.text: Great router/cable modem. Works well on the Cox network although I had to go through 2nd level support to get it to connect. The original phone tech could not get it to work. The 2nd level support tech had it connected in a matter of seconds. Reliable at both 2.4 and 5g wireless and blazing fast when hardwired. Goes without saying that it depends on your connection speed, but the router is not going to slow you down.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Pate

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working, multiple disconnections and had to reboot to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Best modem router I've had
customer_reviews.text: This modem router is better than others I've had, which were not bad at all, but this one stands out from the rest. Speed, reliability and functionality, all in one is a great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with FIOS Internet 1G
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to connect the unit only to find out it didn't have a WAN port to connect for data. So disappointed. However, I'm exploring the use of ORBI with the new FIOS modem/router. My goal is to rid use of rental equipment from Verizon.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Gateway/Modem
customer_reviews.text: For the distances that the wifi bands travel and the speed, it's been great after 1 month. There is still a small hipcuff in the Readyshare (not reporting the correct free space on it), but other than that, it's a product.
customer_reviews.author: Danny R.

customer_reviews.title: Tech support from Netgear
customer_reviews.text: Netgear wants to charge for support and wants to have customer return defective unite before sending replacement!!@!
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne Ayres

customer_reviews.title: Fast, consistent internet
customer_reviews.text: This modem/ routers has been a godsend! We now have consistent internet with great speeds on both upload and download. So much better than the crap our ISP was leasing us. I wish I had gotten this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: lioness08332

customer_reviews.title: One heck of a range booster
customer_reviews.text: My internet is insane fast now, no more wireless disconnects I have a 1 acre lot and it has WiFi everywhere now
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R.

customer_reviews.title: 0 support from netgear.
customer_reviews.text: 5 months of hell with this horrible product. It says its supported and this modem wont work. Netgear also doesn't provide any support whatsoever so thats just great.
customer_reviews.author: I Dont know

customer_reviews.title: WiFi quit in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Quit working less than a year old. Telephone tech support is only for 90 days then it costs $ for support
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement in Wireless Coverage
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to set-up, I did have to call my cable company to gt the service hooked up to it. It does what they say and the service is faster, and I can get wireless coverage throughout my home now.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Riehle

customer_reviews.title: It works really well. Easy to install. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. Easy to install. I highly recommend. Probably better than comcast modem and wifi router.
customer_reviews.author: JORGE BOSE

customer_reviews.title: total junk
customer_reviews.text: Less than 6 months modem went down plus both extenders as tested by Tech Support. I want my money back!!!! I will try to get Amazon to help and will up date soon
customer_reviews.author: Steve E.

customer_reviews.title: Gets us internet
customer_reviews.text: It works great and serves its purpose. Quite expensive but didn't have a choice.........almost.
customer_reviews.author: Puddypie

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast with a lot of power if activated properly
customer_reviews.text: Great unit if activated properly. I have comcast gigabit internet and this beast can handle it plus 2 Gaming PCs, 3 rokus 1 is 4k, a ps4 pro, 2 ps4 slims and 4 ps3s without internet performance taking a hit. I would definitely recommend this over the xb6. Ps. Remember every wifi card has a download cap like my phone caps at 350mbs no matter the wifi no matter the connection cable or fiber.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Finally cut the cord
customer_reviews.text: 03.24.19 Swapped out Comcast/xFinity cable modem/router with this Nighthawk X4S. Installation was very easy. Note when you change your router name and password in the router you need to change it in two places, once in the 2.4 GHZ section and again in the 5 GHZ section of the page. Now using Youtube TV and trading in my cable boxes and landline. Wifi speed varies during the day per speedtest but we have two iPhones, two iPad, 2 PC's, and 3 TV's all on wifi, and have not experienced noticeable lag. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Cruz Director

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Toatlly useless. I bought it last month. Don't have proper signal and speed also. Even it stops working sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: We are using this for a full whole house wireless so far no extender needed. House is about 4500 sq ft. Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.author: Green One

customer_reviews.title: Might be great
customer_reviews.text: The problem is . You will need a newer version of Coaxial cable and internet to take full advantage
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: Love this mode
customer_reviews.text: Love this mode. Connected to Xfinity with little effort. Once connected, the download speed gradually increases to your maximum allowed speed. Mine downloads three times as fast as the speed I'm paying for. Well worth ever penny.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced my outdated Comcast modem with this new one. My internet speed jump up from 60 Mbps to 100 to 150 Mbps. Signal is very. I will get my money back if it last for 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Need For Speed

customer_reviews.title: Netgear does not honor their hardware warranty - Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Upload speed on my network started dying out completely while trying to stream to Twitch. Contacted my ISP twice which let me know that the signal to the modem was good and that I should contact Netgear. Netgear will NOT help you unless you have a Phone Support Plan which makes their 1-YR hardware warranty worthless unless you're OK having to pony up extra cash.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid modem/router combo. Great for GIG internet. Has all the bells and whistles. Wish it had a few more features on the webui. The parental control features are via a Netgear app and they are awful.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great combo option!
customer_reviews.text: While other reviews have sided that this particular router has been faulty, I found that worked extremely well. I have a strong signal, excellent connectivity, in very simple user interface to make needed and suggested, even advanced, changes if needed. I really love this combo package!
customer_reviews.author: bE

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install, up and running in less then 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: From first box open to internet up less then 30 minutes on xfinity. The firmware upgrade took about 5 minutes of that, but otherwise seamless install. No real speed difference (I just wanted to combine the router/gateway for less wires) but overall satisfied. Will see if there are any hickups after a couple of weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: jmg

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY OF THE HIGHER PRICE.
customer_reviews.text: INSTALLED IN MINUTES BY XFINITY AGENT. WORKS PERFECTLY AT 250 MBPS WITH 8 DEVICES ONLINE. GOOD INTERACTIVE WEB PAGE. GOOD MANUAL. IF THERE WERE EARLIER PROBLEMS (SEE OLDER REVIEWS), THEY'RE GONE NOW. ONLY THING MISSING IS DESCRIPTION/EXPLANATION OF ANTENNA PATTERNS.
customer_reviews.author: WAYNE N.

customer_reviews.title: Nighthawk router
customer_reviews.text: This router provides full wifi coverage in every corner of my house. It is the first router I have had that covers my house.
customer_reviews.author: AddictedtoAmazonPrime

customer_reviews.title: Lightning Fast
customer_reviews.text: Had to purchase to replace the stock Comcast modem for Gigabit internet and although the price is steep it should be worth it in the long run. Easy Setup, easy customization, and overall quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Olsa.dub

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Except Positives
customer_reviews.text: The X4S holds up to the expectations set by Netgear. Wi-Fi is lightning fast speeds and when hardwired, you would think the computer reads minds with how quick it loads before even taking my finger off the enter/return key. 10/10 would recommend to everyone. From gaming to daily business tasks, this is the 2-in-1 you want in a home and/or office environment.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok
customer_reviews.text: I got a high power line across the street so my signal even with this isn’t clear.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Skinner

customer_reviews.title: 2019 review
customer_reviews.text: I bought a warranty for this, after 3 months of use and 11 devices connected it runs great with xfinity no problems. I use the highest tier for xfinity speed, and haven't come across slow internet.
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo P.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Cox
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for over a year. Works fine with Cox internet.
customer_reviews.author: Orbital

customer_reviews.title: This router is better than advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router and upped my speed to 1 gig. (Cox) it was super easy to setup and pushes super fast WiFi to every inch of my 2 story 2500 sqft home. Buy this router!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: We have a very large house and good connectivity everywhere including to the
customer_reviews.text: Killer powerful. We have a very large house and good connectivity everywhere including to the dock
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have security to rely on wifi beware of this product.
customer_reviews.text: This modem loses internet signal and will stop putting out the built in wifi signal.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: SUPER easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up and works so much better than my Xfinity router/modem. My TV no longer loses network connection.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Lilli

customer_reviews.title: Don’t need to restart it like other ones I used to have
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable, worth the money. Don’t need to restart it like other ones I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: MartyMar

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: It would disconnect all the time. Had to buy another cable modem and router to resolve the issue. Stuck with it because the return period expired. Lost my 400 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: 2. 4G channel stopped working after a year. ...
customer_reviews.text: 2.4G channel stopped working after a year. Have tried downgrading and upgrading updated, and everything else suggested on the forums without being able to fix it. Supposedly its an update issue the netgear is completely aware of and don't want to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Louque

customer_reviews.title: Great Product +++
customer_reviews.text: Really fast internet, wired, wireless and the usb, I use both bands and I completely satisfied with this purchase. Just the size is big! Almost as same size as the Comcast tv box. But anyways I can deal with it.+++++
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT

customer_reviews.title: Fastest Internet
customer_reviews.text: The combination modem router is amazing. The internet speeds are the fastest I've had at home. The wireless configuration took less than an hour for all my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Webjibaro

product_meta.title: NETGEAR C7800 Modem (Old Model)
product_meta.description: Style:2000Mbps Max Download | WiFi AC3200NETGEAR Nighthawk X4S AC3200 WiFi DOCSIS 3.1 Ultra High Speed Cable Modem Router is the industry’s fastest cable modem router. Works with the fastest DOCSIS 3.0 and ready for new DOCSIS 3.1 gigabit Internet speeds. The NETGEAR X4S DOCSIS 3.1 Cable Modem Router offers blazing fast Internet speeds that rivals the speed of Fiber. Enjoy quality experience for streaming multiple HD quality videos to multiple devices, VR gaming and more. Eliminate Internet service provider equipment rental fees and save up to $120 a year. WiFi Technology 802.11ac
feature_bullets: COMPATIBLE WITH ALL MAJOR CABLE INTERNET PROVIDERS: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast and COX. NOT compatible with Spectrum, Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service
SAVE MONTHLY RENTAL FEES: Model C7800 replaces your cable modem and WiFi router saving you up to $150/yr in equipment rental fees
BUILT FOR ULTIMATE SPEED: Best for cable provider plans up to 2 Gigabits speed
FAST WiFi PERFORMANCE: Get up to 3000 square feet wireless coverage and 45 devices connected with AC3200 speed (up to 3200 Mbps)
VERSATILE CONNECTIONS: 4 Gigabit Ethernet ports and 2 hi speed USB 3.0 ports give you fast wired connections to your computer, printer, game box, storage drive, and other devices

MODEM TECHNOLOGY: Engineered with 32x8 channel bonding and DOCSIS 3.1. System Requirements Microsoft Windows 7, 8, 10, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS or other operating systems running a TCP/IP network. Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0, Safari 1.4 or Google Chrome 11.0 browsers or higher. Not compatible with Cable bundled voice services
SAFE & SECURE: Includes parental controls, and supports WEP and WPA/WPA2 wireless security protocols

specifications.Wireless Type: 5 GHz Radio Frequency, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
